collectionDescription: The High Resolution Water Layer (HRWL) product provides classified maps showing permanent water, temporary water, dry areas, and sea water. It is a multi-annual product, typically covering a 7-year period, and is updated every 3 years. The product is generated at the European scale with a spatial resolution of 10 m Ã— 10 m. It is based on the annual Water Cover Duration (WCD) production, which combines water masks from Sentinel-1 radar and Sentinel-2 optical imagery with Water/Ice Cover data from Sentinel-2 (WIC S2). HRWL is available for the reference years 2021 and 2024 and can be downloaded in multiple projections and pixel spacings. More information here.

layers.longDescription: Classified layer, differentiating the classes of permanent water (1), temporary water (2), and dry areas (0). The dataset can also have the following values: cloud or cloud shadow (205), sea water (253), or no data (255)
Occurrence of water areas throughout the entire observation period (between 0 and 100).
Quality layer providing an assessment of the water layer (WL) quality (between 0 and 100).
